Dialogue.Page: Hello there, space cadet! I hear you’re leaving the crater today.
If you meet any of the other travelers up there, remind them to take proper care of their instruments, won’t you?

DialogueOption.Text: Gneiss! I heard what sounds like Feldspar's harmonica echoing from a bramble seed that landed on Timber Hearth!
Tell me about the travelers’ instruments.
Just saying hi before I leave.

Dialogue.Page: Goodness me! Didn't you just wake up, space cadet? Was that what Tektite saw crashing earlier on Youngbark Crater?
But is that true, what you said about the harmonica?
Oh stars above, do you think.. there's a chance our dear Feldspar is alive after all? After all this time we've been so worried for them!
Dear Chert once told me the bramble was nothing but trouble.. To think one of its seeds would bring us such good news today!
Say, you're sure the harmonica was echoing from inside the seed, is that right?
Do you imagine Feldspar would be able to hear us through the seed too, from the other side?

That's it. I'll rally up the village and we'll all go play a little ditty into the seed, and shout some words of motivation to cheer Feldspar on, wherever they might be stranded! Yes, yes - the orchestra must assemble!

DialogueOption.Text: I could help bring Hal's accordion and Gossan's fiddle over to Youngbark Crater.
Maybe I could.. um, contribute some whistling?

Dialogue.Page: Oh, no, you needn't trouble yourself like that, hatchling - but that's very kind of you!
You're beginning your own journey today, my brave cadet. You musn't let our silly space legend who's been lost for so long distract you from your special day.
I promise, we'll have Feldspar back before you even finish your first can of marshmallows out there! I'll make sure Hornfels will radio you all about it.
I need to finish tuning this banjo perfectly before our little impromptu performance. Now, off you go, space cadet! Safe travels!
Take care of yourself up in space!
It’s questions like that what make us worried about you going up into space on your own, you know.
The observatory is up the path behind the waterfall. There are a couple of signs marking the way, but really, you just keep going up and then hook a right when you get to the zero-g cave.
Oh, sure! I made all of their instruments, you know. Let me see... There’s Chert’s drums, Riebeck’s banjo, and Gabbro’s flute.
And Feldspar’s harmonica, of course, though Feldspar’s been missing for a long time. Sometimes it feels like just yesterday they were playing their harmonica around the campfire...
Anyway, you hear music in space, that’ll be one of the space program’s other travelers. If you feel like company, you can always pull out your signalscope and track them down.
Trouble is, every time a Hearthian leaves for outer space, that’s one less musician in our orchestra.
So! Did you need something?

DialogueOption.Text: Tell me about the travelers’ instruments.

Dialogue.Page: Everything okay? Seems kind of early for you to be back from space.
Did you need something from me?

DialogueOption.Text: Tell me about the travelers’ instruments.

Dialogue.Page: Alright. Take care, now.
